intro: Bennettiodendron macrophyllum var. obovatum, commonly known as the large-leaf bennettiodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its large, obovate leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish flowers, which are followed by distinctive, three-lobed fruits. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
